unnormalised: Property prices in Mumbai's Bandra West have skyrocketed, with a 2BHK flat now costing upwards of Rs. 5 crores. Real estate agents are saying that the average price per sq ft has crossed Rs. 70,000 in some areas.
normalised: Property prices in Mumbai's Bandra West have skyrocketed, with a two B-H-K flat now costing upwards of rupee five crores. Real estate agents are saying that the average price per square foot has crossed rupee seventy thousand in some areas.

unnormalised: This surge is being attributed to the area's popularity with Bollywood celebrities and business tycoons. Apparently, everyone wants a piece of Bandra! One recent sale saw a sea-facing penthouse go for a whopping Rs. 25 cr. Can you imagine?!
normalised: This surge is being attributed to the area's popularity with Bollywood celebrities and business tycoons. Apparently, everyone wants a piece of Bandra! One recent sale saw a sea-facing penthouse go for a whopping rupee twenty five crore. Can you imagine?!

unnormalised: Experts are divided on whether this bubble will burst. Some say the demand is genuine, driven by the area's prime location and amenities. Others warn of overvaluation and the possibility of a correction. A similar story is unfolding in Gurgaon's Sector 42, where posh villas are now selling for Rs. 10 cr +.
normalised: Experts are divided on whether this bubble will burst. Some say the demand is genuine, driven by the area's prime location and amenities. Others warn of overvaluation and the possibility of a correction. A similar story is unfolding in Gurgaon's Sector forty two, where posh villas are now selling for rupee ten crore plus.

unnormalised: One local broker mentioned that the stamp duty, which is currently at 5%, adds a significant amount to the total cost. Plus, don't forget the registration charges! He added that potential buyers should consider all these factors before making a decision.
normalised: One local broker mentioned that the stamp duty, which is currently at five percent, adds a significant amount to the total cost. Plus, don't forget the registration charges! He added that potential buyers should consider all these factors before making a decision.

unnormalised: Property registrations in Maharashtra saw a rise of 15% in the month of July, compared to last year. That's a pretty big jump! This indicates a continued interest in the real estate market despite the high prices.
normalised: Property registrations in Maharashtra saw a rise of fifteen percent in the month of July, compared to last year. That's a pretty big jump! This indicates a continued interest in the real estate market despite the high prices.

unnormalised: Even smaller towns like Nashik are seeing an uptick, though the price range is obviously much lower. A 1BHK there might set you back around Rs. 30 lakhs. Still, it's a considerable amount for many middle-class families.
normalised: Even smaller towns like Nashik are seeing an uptick, though the price range is obviously much lower. A one B-H-K there might set you back around rupee thirty lakhs. Still, it's a considerable amount for many middle-class families.

unnormalised: So, whether you're looking to buy or sell, it's important to do your research and stay informed. The real estate market is always changing, and what's true today might not be true tomorrow.
normalised: So, whether you're looking to buy or sell, it's important to do your research and stay informed. The real estate market is always changing, and what's true today might not be true tomorrow.
